newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL palm oil futures down on Pakistan devaluation.
newsitem.headline: KL palm oil futures down on Pakistan devaluation.

text.p: Malaysian palm oil prices fell in early afternoon trading on news that Pakistan has devalued its currency, traders said.
Malaysia's third month January palm oil futures fell nine ringgit to 1,097 ringgit ($437.92) a tonne from midday's close of 1,106.
The news that the State (central) Bank of Pakistan (SBP) devalued the rupee by 7.86 percent against the dollar on Tuesday came in after the close of the morning session.
The SBP moved the rupee down to 40.1200/40.3206 to the dollar from 36.9700/37.1549.
"The rupee devaluation means that Pakistan has to cough out more money to buy palm oil," a trader said, adding this would surely slow down Malaysia's exports of palm oil to Pakistan.
Pakistan on Tuesday tendered to buy 9,000 tonnes of RBD palm oil for first-half November shipment. Traders said the market was unsure if Pakistan will buy.- Tan Lee Lee (603-230 7510)
